alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Jones (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 12 at 5:57PM CDT until March 12 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN JASPER AND NORTHEASTERN JONES COUNTIES... At 557 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Sandersville, or 12 miles northeast of Laurel, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Jasper and northeastern Jones Counties. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
